Glossary.Information Protection: A collection of capabilities in Microsoft 365 used to classify, label, and protect data across its lifecycle.
Glossary.Data Classification: The process of identifying, categorizing, and labeling data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements.
Glossary.Sensitive Information Types (SITs): Predefined or custom patterns used to detect sensitive data such as financial, personal, or health information.
Glossary.Custom Sensitive Information Types: User-defined SITs created to detect organization-specific data patterns.
Glossary.Trainable Classifiers: Machine-learning models that classify content based on examples rather than pattern matching.
Glossary.Exact Data Match (EDM): A classification method that identifies sensitive data by matching exact values from a secure database.
Glossary.Document Fingerprinting: A technique that creates a unique signature from a standard document to detect similar content across an organization.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Information Protection: A suite of tools for labeling, classifying, and protecting sensitive data across Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Sensitivity Labels: Metadata-based labels applied to documents, emails, and containers to enforce protection settings.
Glossary.Label Policies: Rules that publish sensitivity labels to users and define how labels can be applied.
Glossary.Auto-Labeling: Automated application of sensitivity labels based on content inspection and classification rules.
Glossary.Double Key Encryption (DKE): An encryption method where Microsoft holds one key and the organization holds the second, ensuring exclusive data access.
Glossary.Information Rights Management (IRM): A protection technology that restricts actions such as copying, printing, or forwarding sensitive content.
Glossary.Data Loss Prevention (DLP): Policies that detect and prevent the unintentional sharing of sensitive information across Microsoft 365 services.
Glossary.Endpoint DLP: DLP capabilities applied directly on Windows and macOS devices to monitor and restrict risky actions.
Glossary.DLP Policies: Rules that identify sensitive data and enforce protective actions such as blocking, auditing, or notifying users.
Glossary.DLP Policy Tips: User-facing notifications that appear when sensitive data handling violates a DLP rule.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Managem: Tools for managing retention, deletion, and governance of data across its lifecycle.
Glossary.Retention Labels: Labels that define how long content must be retained and what happens when the retention period ends.
Glossary.Retention Policies: Organization-wide rules that apply retention settings to content locations such as SharePoint, Exchange, and Teams.
Glossary.Adaptive Scopes: Dynamic scopes that automatically include users, sites, or groups based on attributes.
Glossary.Records Management: Capabilities that classify, retain, and dispose of business records in compliance with regulations.
Glossary.Regulatory Compliance: The process of meeting legal, industry, and organizational requirements for data protection and governance.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: A centralized interface for managing compliance, data protection, and risk-related features.
Glossary.Compliance Manager: A tool that provides assessments, improvement actions, and compliance scoring to help manage regulatory obligations.
Glossary.Compliance Score: A measurement of how well an organization meets recommended compliance actions.
Glossary.Insider Risk Management: Capabilities that detect, investigate, and mitigate risky user behavior within an organization.
Glossary.Insider Risk Policies: Rules that identify risky activities such as data exfiltration, security violations, or insider threats.
Glossary.Risk Indicators: Signals such as file downloads, USB usage, or anomalous behavior used to detect potential insider risks.
Glossary.Communication Compliance: A feature that monitors internal and external communications for policy violations or inappropriate content.
Glossary.Information Barriers: Policies that restrict communication and collaboration between specific groups to prevent conflicts of interest.
Glossary.eDiscovery (Standard): Tools for searching and exporting content across Microsoft 365 for legal or investigative purposes.
Glossary.eDiscovery (Premium): Advanced eDiscovery capabilities including legal holds, review sets, analytics, and case management.
Glossary.Legal Hold: A mechanism that preserves content immutably for legal or investigative requirements.
Glossary.Review Sets: Collections of data used for analysis, tagging, and export during eDiscovery investigations.
Glossary.Custodians: Individuals whose data is relevant to an eDiscovery case.
Glossary.Audit (Standard): Basic auditing capabilities that track user and admin activities across Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Audit (Premium): Enhanced auditing with longer retention and high-value events for security investigations.
Glossary.Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps: A cloud access security broker (CASB) that provides visibility, control, and threat protection for cloud applications.
Glossary.Shadow IT Discovery: The process of identifying and analyzing unauthorized or unmanaged cloud app usage.
Glossary.App Governance: Advanced monitoring and control of OAuth-enabled applications in Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Conditional Access: Policies that enforce access controls based on user, device, location, and risk signals.
Glossary.Identity Protection: Risk-based identity security features that detect compromised accounts and enforce remediation.
Glossary.Privileged Access Management (PAM): Controls that limit and monitor high-privilege operations within Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): A permission model that assigns access based on job roles rather than individual users.
Glossary.Zero Trust: A security model that assumes breach and enforces continuous verification of identity, device, and context.
Glossary.Microsoft Secure Score: A measurement of an organization’s security posture with recommendations for improvement.
Glossary.Attack Simulation Training: Phishing and social engineering simulations used to educate and test users on security awareness.
Glossary.Threat Protection Integration: The alignment of Microsoft 365 security tools to detect, investigate, and respond to threats.
Glossary.Data Connectors: Integrations that bring external data sources into Microsoft Purview for compliance and governance.
Glossary.Information Governance: The overall framework for managing data retention, deletion, and regulatory compliance.
Glossary.Content Explorer: A tool that provides visibility into where sensitive data resides across Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Activity Explorer: A dashboard that shows how sensitive data is being used and accessed within the organization.
Glossary.Endpoint Management Integration: The connection between Microsoft Purview and Intune to enforce data protection on devices.
Glossary.Service Encryption: Encryption applied at the service level to protect data at rest within Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Customer Key: An encryption option that allows organizations to control their own encryption keys for Microsoft 365 data.
Glossary.Data Residency: The geographic location where an organization’s Microsoft 365 data is stored and processed.
Glossary.Multi-Geo: A feature that allows organizations to store data in multiple geographic locations to meet compliance needs.
Glossary.Microsoft Graph API for Compliance: APIs that allow programmatic access to compliance data and configuration.
Glossary.Privacy Risk Management: Tools that identify and mitigate privacy-related risks in Microsoft 365.
Glossary.Data Subject Requests (DSR): Requests from individuals to access, correct, or delete their personal data under privacy laws.
Glossary.Information Protection Scanner: A tool that scans on-premises file shares for sensitive data and applies labels.
Glossary.Endpoint Sensitivity Labeling: The ability for devices to apply and enforce sensitivity labels locally.
Glossary.Unified Labeling Client: A legacy client for applying sensitivity labels, now replaced by built-in labeling.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Analytics: Dashboards and insights that help identify risky user behavior trends.
Glossary.Adaptive Protection: A system that dynamically adjusts user protections based on risk levels.
Glossary.Data Access Governance (DAG): Capabilities that analyze permissions and access patterns to identify excessive or risky access.
Glossary.Access Reviews: Periodic evaluations of user access to ensure permissions remain appropriate.
Glossary.Privileged Identity Management (PIM): A service that provides just-in-time access and oversight for privileged roles.
Glossary.Conditional Access App Control: Real-time session monitoring and control for cloud apps.
Glossary.Session Policies: Rules that govern user actions during active cloud app sessions.
Glossary.Endpoint Discovery: The process of identifying sensitive data stored on user devices.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Risk & Compliance Dash: A unified view of compliance posture, alerts, and insights.
Glossary.Data Map: A catalog of data assets and their relationships across the organization.
Glossary.Data Catalog: A searchable inventory of data sources, classifications, and metadata.
Glossary.Data Estate Insights: Analytics that provide visibility into data usage, classification, and governance.
Glossary.Information Protection Analytics: Reports that show label usage, trends, and protection coverage.
Glossary.Compliance Boundaries: Controls that restrict access to compliance data based on geography or organizational structure.
Glossary.Sensitivity Label Inheritance: The automatic propagation of labels from containers to content.
Glossary.Sensitivity Label Priority: The order in which labels override each other when multiple rules apply.
Glossary.Microsoft Purview Message Encryption: Email encryption capabilities integrated with sensitivity labels.
Glossary.Secure Multipurpose Internet Mail Extens: A standard for email encryption and digital signatures.
Glossary.Data Minimization: A principle that limits data collection to what is necessary for business purposes.
Glossary.Privacy by Design: An approach that embeds privacy considerations into systems and processes from the start.
